===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[die]], [[death]], [[dead]].
#: {{zh-x|餓死|to '''die''' of starvation}}
#: {{zh-x|佢 兩 年 前 已經 死 咗。|He already '''died''' two years ago.|C}}
#: {{zh-x|高校 學生 食堂 吃 出 死 老鼠。|A '''dead''' mouse was found in college cafeteria food.}}
# [[inactive]]
#: {{zh-x|死結|'''encased''' knot}}
#: {{zh-x|死機|(of a computer system) to '''crash'''}}
#: {{zh-x|路 被 垃圾 堵 死 了。|The road is '''blocked''' by wastes.}}
# {{lb|zh|only in compounds}} [[deadly]]; [[fatal]]; [[killing]]
#: {{zh-x|死刑|'''capital''' punishment}}
#: {{zh-x|死戰|'''deadly''' battle}}
# {{lb|zh|colloquial}} [[very]]; [[bloody]]; [[totally]]
#* {{zh-x|我 累{lèi} 死 了。|I'm '''dead''' tired.}}
#* {{zh-x|他 死 鸭子 嘴 硬。|He is pretty stubborn.}}
#* {{zh-x|嘈 死！|You're being '''really''' noisy!|C}}
# {{lb|zh|offensive}} [[damned]]; [[damn]]
#* {{zh-x|呢{nei1}個 死 阿伯 唔識 揸車。|This '''damn''' geezer can't drive.|C}}
#* {{zh-x|死 鬼佬|'''goddamn''' white|C}}
# {{lb|zh|slang|offensive}} to [[disappear]]; to [[go]]
#* {{zh-x|嗰 枝 死人 原子筆 '''死''' 咗 去 邊 呀？|Where's that goddamn pen?|C-GZ}}
#* {{zh-x|你 這個 死人 '''死''' 到 哪裡 去 了，打 手機 也 不 接。|Where the hell have you '''been'''? Why are you not answering my calls? (said by wife)}}
#* {{zh-x|佢哋 今次 死 咗 去 邊 呀？|Where'd they fuck off to this time?|C}}

====Usage notes====
* The adjective 死 ("dead, inactive, etc.") can not be used as a [[predicative adjective]]. The sentence *這隻狗死 generally does not mean "This dog is dead". For the meaning "is dead", usually the verb 死 in the perfect aspect ("to have died") is used instead:
*: {{zh-x|這 隻 狗 死 了。|This dog has '''died'''.}}
* The verb 死 ("to die") lacks a present meaning and denotes either past (in perfect aspect) or future (not in perfect aspect) events. It can not be modified by the progressive aspect marker [[正在]] or [[着]].
*: {{zh-x|不死|"will not die", immortal}}
*: {{zh-x|没 死|"did not die", alive}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|し}}
Appears to be a [[conflation]] of {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=し}} {{m|ltc|死|tr=sij<sup>X</sup>}} (compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''sǐ'') with an {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=し}} root that happened to have a similar pronunciation to the {{etyl|ltc|-}} and was probably cognate with {{m|ja|去る|tr=saru||to go, to go away}}.

In kanji compounds, this would be considered as {{m|ja|音読み|sc=Latn|on'yomi}}; on its own, this could be considered as either {{m|ja|音読み|sc=Latn|on'yomi}} or {{m|ja|訓読み|sc=Latn|kun'yomi}}.
